name: Milnacipran (Savella)
summary: A serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) approved in the U.S. for the management of fibromyalgia; also used as an antidepressant in other countries.
description: Milnacipran is a serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) that increases levels of serotonin and norepinephrine in the brain, improving pain modulation and mood. While it is approved in the U.S. specifically for fibromyalgia, it is used in other countries as an antidepressant for major depressive disorder. It is generally well tolerated but may cause side effects such as nausea, headache, constipation, and insomnia.

contraindications: Concurrent or recent (within 14 days) MAOI use
Hypersensitivity to milnacipran or any component

items: Major Depressive Disorder (approved in other countries)

sections.text: Inhibits serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake, increasing their availability in the synaptic cleft; this enhances descending pain inhibition pathways and improves mood regulation.

adult.fibromyalgia: Start with 12.5 mg once daily on day 1, then 12.5 mg twice daily on days 2–3, then 25 mg twice daily on days 4–7, then 50 mg twice daily thereafter
adult.depression_outside_us: Typically 50–100 mg twice daily (varies by country)

sections.geriatric: Use with caution; may require lower starting doses
sections.hepatic_impairment: Mild to moderate: no adjustment; severe: use caution
sections.renal_impairment: Moderate: reduce dose by 50%; severe: reduce dose by 75%

sections.text: Pain improvement often within 1–2 weeks; mood improvement may take 2–4 weeks.

sections.black_box: Antidepressants increase the risk of suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults.
other: Monitor for serotonin syndrome, especially with other serotonergic drugs
May increase blood pressure and heart rate—monitor regularly

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh potential risks
sections.lactation: Unknown if excreted in breast milk; use caution

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over 1–2 weeks to minimize withdrawal symptoms such as dizziness, headache, nausea, and irritability.

items: In fibromyalgia, benefits are seen for both pain and fatigue
Not FDA-approved for depression in the U.S., but widely used internationally for MDD
Lower risk of sexual side effects compared to SSRIs
